icontrol

Annotation Type iC_Annotation


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value={METHOD,TYPE})
 @Documented
public @interface iC_Annotation
    declare to keep Annotations until Runtime

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Device.CommPorts[] CommPorts
      This is a promise of the class that all public methods support the specified communication ports/protocols.
      java.lang.String InstrumentClassName
      Defines the name for this class which is used in the Framework-Command MAKE for Instruments of this class.
      boolean MethodChecksSyntax
      When true, this signals that the method baring this annotation does check the syntax, hence, the dispatcher should call this method when performing the syntax check.

    • Element Detail

      • MethodChecksSyntax

        public abstract boolean MethodChecksSyntax
        When true, this signals that the method baring this annotation does check the syntax, hence, the dispatcher should call this method when performing the syntax check.

        When the syntax check fails, the method should throw a DataFormatException which will then be shown to the user by re-throwing as ScriptException in Device.DispatchCommand which is caught in Dispatcher.run.

        Returns:
        true if the method performs a Syntax-Check
        Default:
        false

      • CommPorts

        public abstract Device.CommPorts[] CommPorts
        This is a promise of the class that all public methods support the specified communication ports/protocols.
        Returns:
        The supported communication protocols
        Default:
        {}

      • InstrumentClassName

        public abstract java.lang.String InstrumentClassName
        Defines the name for this class which is used in the Framework-Command MAKE for Instruments of this class. This name also shows up in the GUI.

        This name is used in Dispatcher.RegisterDeviceClasses()

        Returns:
        The name of this class used in the Framework-Command MAKE
        Default:
        ""
